sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The description and use of an ordinary joynt-rule fitted with lines for the ready finding the lengths and angles of rafters and hips, and collar-beams in any square or bevilling roofes at any pitch, and the ready drawing the architrave, freize and cornice in any order. With other useful conclusions by the said rule. By John Browne. Browne, John, 1642-ca. 1700.
[2], 29, [1] p., 4 leaves of plates
printed for William Fisher at the Postern Gate near Tower-Hill, London : 1669.
Reproduction of the original in the Trinity College Library, Dublin.
=======

With other useful conclusions by the said rule. By John Browne. Browne, John, 1642-ca. 1700.
[2], 29, [1] p., 4 leaves of plates
printed for William Fisher at the Postern Gate near Tower-Hill, London : 1669.
Reproduction of the original in the Trinity College Library, Dublin.
